channel.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com
channel.description: Find the latest automobile Auto Insight, News & Articles from all top sources for the Indian Auto industry on ET Auto.

image.title: Top Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com

item.title: ZF uses software to develop smarter, more connected CV technologies
item.description: ZF is also able to leverage its software domain expertise from other vehicle segments within the ZF Group to produce intelligent systems quickly and cost effectively that can lower the overall total cost of ownership (TCO).

item.title: Ashok Leyland opens ‘Mini Expo’ in Hyderabad to showcase MHCV innovations
item.description: The expo, featuring two simultaneous circuits, aims to bring Ashok Leyland’s advanced technologies closer to customers and enthusiasts. Circuit 2, which began in Bangalore, will continue to cities including Pune, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, and Indore after its stop in Hyderabad.

item.title: US expected to propose barring Chinese software in autonomous vehicles
item.description: The Biden administration plans to issue a proposed rule that would bar Chinese software in vehicles in the United States with Level 3 automation and above, which would have the effect of also banning testing on U.S. roads of autonomous vehicles produced by Chinese companies.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki to launch first electric vehicle and promote diverse eco-friendly technologies in FY24
item.description: Maruti Suzuki revealed intentions to introduce its first electric vehicle this financial year and promote diverse eco-friendly technologies like hybrid, biogas, and CNG to reduce emissions. Chairman R C Bhargava highlighted a diversified strategy to meet national objectives. The company aims to cater to different market segments while continuing to produce affordable small cars.

item.title: Ethanol maker TruAlt Bio plans to float INR 1,000 cr IPO
item.description: TruAlt Bioenergy, a Bengaluru-based ethanol manufacturer, planned a INR 1,000 crore initial public offering, filing the prospectus with SEBI soon. The IPO included fresh issuance and sale from existing shareholders. The company's revenues rose to INR 1,225 crore in FY24 from INR 768 crore in FY23. TruAlt Bioenergy began operations in October 2022 with distilleries in Karnataka.

item.title: Ola Electric’s Kripa Ananthan says circular economy needs to be implemented from the designing stage itself
item.description: Speakers at the ETAuto Tech Summit 2024 highlighted how sustainability in manufacturing has to be incorporated at the design stage itself along with upskilling of human resources. The use of recycled, refurbished, and remanufactured items benefit the auto industry by reducing cost of manufacturing and cost of ownership.

item.title: Big truckmakers bet on hydrogen to extend combustion engine life
item.description: The global truck making industry faces a complex balancing act to get to zero emissions. Electric batteries are too heavy for long-haul freight operations and take long to charge. Using hydrogen fuel cells to generate electricity reduces the weight and extends the range of trucks, but switching to this technology is expensive as companies need to design new truck systems.

item.title: 'Opportunistic': Ola Electric CEO Bhavish Aggarwal slams MapMyIndia over lawsuit
item.description: Ola Electric's founder Bhavish Aggarwal defended the company following MapMyIndia's lawsuit for alleged data theft. The lawsuit was filed ahead of Ola's INR 5,500 crore IPO. Ola dismissed the claims, asserting their business integrity and intent to respond to the allegations in due course.

item.title: Thales and Garuda Aerospace sign MoU for promoting secure drone operations in India
item.description: The partnership aims to promote the development of the drone ecosystem in India.

item.title: Ecozen and Volektra join hands to develop sustainable EV technology
item.description: A key facet of this partnership is the integration of Ecozen’s controllers into Volektra’s innovative Vollkits. These plug-and-play conversion units, which utilize Volektra’s proprietary VSAC technology, have already been successful in the European market.

item.title: Hyundai, Kia showcase integrated air taxi service tech
item.description: Hyundai Motor and Kia, South Korea's leading automotive companies, on Monday held a joint demonstration for their integrated air taxi service technology in Indonesia, the companies said.

item.title: Musk to discuss USD 5 bn xAI investment with Tesla board
item.description: Musk, the world's richest person, launched xAI last year in a bid to compete with Microsoft-backed OpenAI. That sparked concerns he may allocate some resources of the automaker to the AI company.

item.title: India is still some time away from experiencing V2X technology
item.description: The automotive industry is witnessing a surge in connected vehicles with V2X technology. For experiencing V2X technology at a large scale in India, people will have to wait for a few more years as per industry experts.

item.title: A new wave of electric vehicles are ready to charge at 70 mph
item.description: Despite the advances in electric vehicle range, range anxiety persists. Hybrid models, such as the forthcoming Ramcharger, use gas engines to charge batteries, offering an interim solution. These hybrids cater to drivers hesitant to fully embrace electric vehicles amidst slow-charging infrastructure improvements, blending electric efficiency with gasoline reliability.

item.title: Thailand to offer investment incentives for makers of hybrid vehicles
item.description: "Thailand has the capacity to be a key producer of hybrid vehicles ... and supporting hybrid production will preserve auto parts manufacturing," he said, adding the measures are expected to draw in 50 billion baht (USD 1.39 billion) worth of investments.

item.title: JioThings,MediaTek partner for indigenously made smart IoT tech for 2 wheeler EVs
item.description: "Jio Things is pleased to collaborate with MediaTek to revolutionize the Mobility industry with our 4G Smart Android Digital Cluster, App Suite and Smart Module solutions," Jio Platforms, President and CEO, Kiran Thomas said.

item.title: Google Maps to alert about road widths, flyovers, EV charging stations in India
item.description: "To address this, we've developed an AI model specifically for Indian roads that incorporates multiple signals -- satellite imagery, Street View, and other information like road types, distance between buildings, paved sections, etc. to estimate road widths at scale," informed Miriam Daniel, VP and GM, Google Maps.

item.title: The lower the AI exposure, the bigger the problem for Europe's chip firms
item.description: Companies with less AI exposure meanwhile were hit harder by industrial clients and automakers cutting orders. Demand for electric vehicles has slowed sharply in Europe.

item.title: NXP slides as weak forecast stokes demand worries among auto chipmakers
item.description: As a result, CEO Sievers expects 2024 annual revenue to decline in the low single-digit range. NXP expects internal inventory levels to start coming down in the fourth quarter and get back in order in 2025.

item.title: GM slams brakes on self-driving vehicle without steering wheel
item.description: GM will instead use a conventional next-generation Bolt EV as the platform for its Cruise robotaxi, a move that will not require permission of U.S. regulators.
